definition: Pingfang district of Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1] in Heilongjiang
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)
Pingfang district of Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1] in Heilongjiang

sentences.english: It was a romantic seaside town filled with small white bungalows .
sentences.chinese: 在這個浪漫的海邊小鎮裏，有很多白色的小平房。

sentences.english: It was a seaside town filled with small white bungalows.
sentences.chinese: 這個海邊小鎮上都是白色小平房。

sentences.english: It was discovered in a bungalow in Pinner in North West London during a house clearance.
sentences.chinese: 它是在清理倫敦西北部的平納區的平房時被發現的。

sentences.english: WARNING- When booking ensure you don't get a bungalow near the wall.
sentences.chinese: 預定房間時確認你訂的小平房不靠近牆。

sentences.english: There are small houses in the village.
The old couple sell that large house and move into a small bungalow.
sentences.chinese: 老兩口賣掉了那幢大房子，搬進了小平房。

sentences.english: Is your apa tment a one-storey or a two-storey house?
sentences.chinese: 你們的公寓是平房還是兩層的？

sentences.english: Our , so-called 'villa by the sea was a small bung alow two miles from the coast.
sentences.chinese: 我們的所謂海濱別墅是離海岸兩英里的一座小平房。

sentences.english: His country cottage turned out to be an enormous bung alow.
sentences.chinese: 他的“鄉下房子”原來是一座大平房。

sentences.english: He had lent the bungalow to the Conrads for a couple of weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他把那間平房借給康拉德一家住了兩三個星期。

sentences.english: The Robinsons lived in a brick bungalow on the South Side of Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 羅賓遜一家住在芝加哥城南部的一個街區平房裏。

sentences.english: Ty stayed in the white clapboard bungalow he'd lived in with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 泰留在他和妻子曾住過的白色隔板平房。

sentences.english: The old couple sold that large house and moved into a small bungalow.
sentences.chinese: 老兩口賣掉了那幢大房子，搬進了小平房。

sentences.english: On the hillside, a two-story bungalow, overlooking the weird.
sentences.chinese: 山坡上，那所一層樓高的小平房，遠眺很詭異。

sentences.english: More city dwellers moved to live in skyscrapers from their old bungalows .
sentences.chinese: 更多的城市居民從他們的老平房裏搬到了摩天大樓。

sentences.english: A bungalow is a type of house.
sentences.chinese: 小平房是房子的一種類型。

definition: a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
courtyard house with a fully enclosed courtyard (type of Chinese residence)
the store front/the part of a house facing the street serving as a store
compound with many families living together
temporary housing built with wooden planks or other makeshift materials
yaodong (a kind of cave dwelling in the Loess Plateau in northwest China)/CL:孔[kong3]
